Students and alumni celebrate Derwent Day

The inaugural Derwent Day, which took place this Saturday, has been hailed a "wonderful celebration" by University Chancellor Greg Dyke. (Thumbnail credit Alison Weir, widow of the late Derwent Provost Ron Weir, Chancellor Greg Dyke and Anna Claire Younger)

Kids Camp threatened by YUSU restructure

The future of Kids Camp is under threat following the loss of the position of Student Development and Charities Officer this year.

Ben Humphrys surprisingly spoke against the motion of twenty-four hour portering.

Carnage returns to York despite YUSU opposition

Controversial student bar crawl Carnage returned to York this weekend despite strong opposition from YUSU and the NUS.

'Self-congratulatory' Council strips VIP cards from YUM

Heads of York University Media (YUM) have been stripped of their VIP Gold Cards by Union Council due to "personal vendettas against the press".

University fails to provide URY with vital repair works

University Radio York (URY) has claimed that the University has failed to help them with problems of serious damp and flooding in their offices.

Democracy and Services Officer Lewis Bretts has released a set of statistics illustrating the success of The Courtyard so far this term.

YUSU support LGBT campaign

YUSU LGBT officers have voiced their support for NUS' campaign to allow gay and bisexual men to give blood.

Anniversary of York Campus Nursery

York Campus Nursery celebrated its 20th anniversary on Tuesday.

Students mobilise to highlight need for 24-hour campus portering provision

Students have mobilised across campus to protest the recent reductions in portering hours. (Thumbnail credit YUSU and the Derwent JCRC organised sit-ins in Vanbrugh, Langwith and Derwent colleges where students were encouraged to sign a petition is support of 24-hour porters)

YUSU: Portering cuts 'inevitable'

Current YUSU President Tim Ngwena has denied that Scott's comments should be attributed to the Union, or that they undermine the current 'Save the Porters' campaign. (Thumbnail credit Former YUSU President Tom Scott said the proposed cuts weren't "too bad" in a email sent in June)

'Too little, too late'

Porters have been forced to accept that there will not be any return to 24-hour portering across campus, despite student protests.

Portering campaign sees all-night sit-in

Campus wide student protests continued on Wednesday, with students occupying the Porters Lodges in Vanbrugh, Langwith and Derwent

By James Bithell

A fire, which broke out in a kitchen in Derwent A Block, was eventually contained by the Yorkshire fire department this afternoon

The National Union of Students has called for the chief executive of the Student Loans Company, Ralph Seymour-Jackson, to resign

York Lib Dems deny 'buying' members, by subsidising membership costs, to ensure they become the largest student group in the country

The University has been shocked by the death of a second student this week, second year Vanbrugh student Tom Eleftheriades

The University of York has expressed its sadness at the death of Halifax student Chris Woodhead, who passed away last week

Contestants announced for York Come Dancing

York Dancesport has announced this year's contestants for York Come Dancing

University bullish over plans to increase tuition fees

The University of York has chosen not to criticise controversial new tuition fee plans that will lead to burdening students with increasing amounts of debt. (Thumbnail credit GEORGE LOWTHER)

Survey shows students increasingly more satisfied with York

The University of York has made several significant increases in the National Student Survey, including in the feedback and student satisfaction categories (Thumbnail credit Despite a national downturn in student satisfaction, York's ratings have seen a significant increase)

Union secures new assessment deadline

Feedback from assessed work now has to be given to students' within six weeks thanks to a new YUSU proposal. (Thumbnail credit All departments will have only six weeks to provide feedback)

New plans have been unveiled showing how a new swimming pool at the University of York may look. (Thumbnail credit FAULKNERBROWNS ARCHITECTS)
